intro: Lippia praecox var. nyikensis, commonly known as the Nyikensis Lippia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
